info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:49PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mississippi and northwestern Lauderdale Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 349 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Osceola, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blytheville, Osceola, Luxora, Burdette, Ashport, Driver, Lens Ford, O`Donnell Bend, Grider, Tomato, Moran, Tuckertown, Rosa, Golddust, Burton, Rotan, Chilson, Keyes Port and Sans Souci. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and west Tennessee.
